repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Fixes #1785

## Problem
When multiple files are modified externally (creating the W13 "File created after editing started" warning), Neovim currently prompts the user sequentially for every single file. This causes UI interruptions and can force the user to dismiss dozens of dialogs one by one.

## Solution
- Added a helper function to check if a buffer meets the W13 criteria.
- Added a loop in `fileio.c/buf_check_timestamp` to reload all W13 buffers.
- Added a functional test to verify that the prompt handles Load All(!).

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body:
`buf_reload` may free the buffers, which would be a UAF. vim/vim#19317

Also note that you're writing the undo file for the wrong buffer below this; more reason to de-dupe this to avoid such copy-paste errors.

You could remove the need for the `else if` branch entirely by using `if (cur_buf == buf || buf_check_W13(cur_buf))`, using `cur_buf` instead.

```suggestion
```

Can be replaced with `return`s. Also use `true`/`false` in new/factored code.

`Load All` is a confusing name; it looks like it's only reloading buffers to files created outside of Nvim, not already-existing but since modified files. (to avoid only W13)

Especially confusing as it looks like `Load All` will still be presented as an option when checking the timestamp of a buffer to a file modified (but not created) outside of Nvim?

Might be better if it reloads in both cases instead.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3010,12 +3041,15 @@ int buf_check_timestamp(buf_T *buf)
         snprintf(tbuf + tbuflen, tbufsize - (size_t)tbuflen, "
%s", mesg2);
       }
       switch (do_dialog(VIM_WARNING, _("Warning"), tbuf,
-                        _("&OK
&Load File
Load File &and Options"),
+                        _("&OK
&Load File
Load All&!
Load File &and Options"),

comment_data.body:
Thanks for comments!

`Load All` will be presented whenever `can_reload` is set.

> Might be better if it reloads in both cases instead.

In that case, should Nvim reload both buffers modified/created outside of Nvim whenever one warning is triggered (W11/W13)?

Or Nvim only reloads W11 buffers when W11 is triggered and the same for W13?

comment_data.body:
> Or Nvim only reloads W11 buffers when W11 is triggered and the same for W13?

I think both approaches are fine, but this one may be the least surprising.
Makes `Load All` (somewhat) similar to running `:checktime` (without args) with a `FileChangedShell` autocommand that sets `v:fcs_choice` to `reload` if `v:fcs_reason` is alike.

@justinmk What do you think? I think it's still compatible with [this comment](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/1785#issuecomment-1605051577)?

comment_data.body: No strong opinion but that sounds fine. Though if one is significantly simpler to implement than another, I would suggest the simpler one.
